title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department requests the general public to take adequate precautions to minimize damages caused by lightning during thundershowers as the atmospheric conditions are favorable further for afternoon thundershowers in most parts of the island.

title: Police announce post-election measures
byline: The police have announced that the post-election period will remain in effect for one week following the declaration of the general election results.

title: President AKD thanks voters for landmark election victory
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has expressed gratitude to voters for delivering a historic victory in the general election.

title: Indian High Commission welcomes NPP’s win in Sri Lanka, reaffirms commitment to bilateral ties
byline: India extended wishes to Sri Lanka’s National People’s Power (NPP) party after their victory in the country’s parliamentary elections.

title: Over 667,000 votes rejected in 2024 General Election
byline: The Election Commission has confirmed that a total of 667,240 votes were rejected during the 2024 general election.

title: Motorcycle pillion rider killed in collision with a train
byline: A pillion rider traveling on a motorcycle has been killed yesterday (15) when the Udaya Devi Express Train, en route from Batticaloa to Colombo Fort, collided with the motorcycle at Bellankadawala in the Habarana Police Division.

title: Ceylon Chamber of Commerce congratulates newly elected govt
byline: The Ceylon Chamber (CCC) has congratulated the National People’s Power (NPP) led by the President Anura Kumara Dissanayake on securing an overwhelming mandate and majority in the Parliamentary election.

title: Pakistani province declares health emergency due to smog and locks down two cities
byline: A Pakistani province declared a health emergency Friday due to smog and imposed a shutdown in two major cities.

title: Workshop for freshly elected MPs on parliament practices and affairs
byline: The registration activities of newly elected Members of Parliament are scheduled to begin from tomorrow (17).

title: New govt’s policy statement to be presented at Parliament’s inaugural session
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will present the government’s policy statement at the inaugural session of the 10th Parliament on November 21 at 3.00 p.m., the Parliamentary Communications Department announced.

title: SLPP nominates Namal Rajapaksa for its only National List seat
byline: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) has decided to nominate Namal Rajapaksa as an MP through the party’s National List, SLPP General Secretary Sagara Kariyawasam said.

title: “Voters have spoken”: Mahindananda announces retirement from politics
byline: Former Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage announced his retirement from active politics during a press conference held at the Mahindananda Aluthgamage Foundation’s office in Nawalapitiya this morning (16).

title: CC confirms Murdhu Fernando as Chief Justice
byline: The Constitutional Council has approved the recommendation to appoint Justice Murdu Fernando as the Chief Justice.

title: From 3% to 61%: Six major records NPP broke in historic election victory
byline: The 2024 General Election marked a resounding victory for the National People’s Power (NPP) led by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, setting unprecedented records in Sri Lanka’s electoral history.

title: Sri Lanka’s President to elect 25-member Cabinet on Monday
byline: Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will appoint a new Prime Minister and the Cabinet on Monday (Nov. 18) after his National People’s Power (NPP) secured a record-breaking victory in the snap general election, the party’s senior spokesman Tilvin Silva said.

title: Russian tourist alleges sexual assault at hotel in Ahungalla
byline: A 41-year-old Russian woman staying at a popular hotel in Ahungalla has alleged that she was raped by a hotel employee on November 12, according to police.

title: “Got exactly what we expected. SLPP will never quit”: MR on election result
byline: The leader of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP), former President Mahinda Rajapaksa claims that the party received the exact number of votes they had expected.

title: Philippines evacuates tens of thousands as super typhoon Man-Yi nears
byline: The Philippines evacuated tens of thousands of people from their homes and cancelled dozens of flights on Saturday, as a super typhoon threatened to unleash heavy rains and powerful winds that could trigger floods and storm surges.

title: Sajith Premadasa’s vote count plummeted by more than half in Colombo District
byline: The Colombo District has seen a profound shift in voter dynamics in the 2024 General Election, with the leader of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Sajith Premadasa suffering a significant decline in support.

title: 2024 General Election: Voter turnout down 10% compared to presidential poll
byline: The Commissioner General of Elections Saman Sri Rathnayake states that there has been a significant reduction by 10% of the voter turnout in 2024 General Election, in comparison with Sri Lanka’s Presidential Election which was held in September 21.

title: Names of all elected parliamentarians gazetted
byline: The names of all the Members of the Parliament who were elected through the 2024 General Election have been gazetted.

title: Plantation youth and women poised for political change: Newly elected MP Ambika Samuel
byline: Ambika Samuel, the newly elected female representative to Parliament, has expressed confidence in the potential of the youth in plantation community and beyond to take an active role in politics.

title: Seelarathana Thero questions delay in releasing Colombo, Gampaha preference vote results
byline: Ven. Battaramulle Seelarathana Thero, who contested the 2024 Parliamentary Election from the Colombo District, has raised serious concerns over the preferential vote results for the Colombo and Gampaha Districts, alleging a possible “deal” behind the numbers.

title: UNP decides to contest all upcoming elections only under ‘elephant’ symbol
byline: A special discussion on the future political direction of the United National Party (UNP) was held this morning (16) under the leadership of the party’s leader, former President Ranil Wickremesinghe. Several former UNP Members of Parliament participated in the meeting.
